page.title: 19A LOCAL VICAR.
page.content: The{Rev. Rimmer}is the{Parish Vicar} for{Old Marston.}His church,{St.} {Nicholas'}is the church that{Oliver} {Cromwell}used to keep watch over the Royalist troops during the{Civil} {War.}He is a very busy man who apart from conducting services, visits the old and sick. When asked if anything{embarrassing} had happened during his services, he replied, "A visiting ringer once went up on the end of the bellrope ... A preacher with his leg in plaster fell up the pulpit stairs, as the choir sang, 'Let not my slippery footsteps slide, and hold me lest I fall' ... A bride fainted{3}times during her marriage ... and the organ caught fire at the end of a children's service!"
